title: How to Contribute
text: Contributions, issues, fixes welcome! making changes data, must done raw txt files. generate_data.R script automates creating RDA files accompanying documentation. Fork clone repo Install pre-commit hooks Create new branch Make changes Run generate_data.R script made changes raw txt files data documentation Render README.md README.qmd made changes README Ensure {testthat} tests pass Submit PR

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jordan Bradford. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bradford J (2024). lovecraftr: H. P. Lovecraft's works, text analysis. https://github.com/jrdnbradford/lovecraftr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {lovecraftr: H. P. Lovecraft's works, for text analysis},   author = {Jordan Bradford},   year = {2024},   url = {https://github.com/jrdnbradford/lovecraftr/}, }

what: H. P. Lovecraft's works, for text analysis
title: H. P. Lovecraft's works, for text analysis
text: merciful thing world, think, inability human mind correlate contents. live placid island ignorance midst black seas infinity, meant voyage far. sciences, straining direction, hitherto harmed us little; day piecing together dissociated knowledge open terrifying vistas reality, frightful position therein, shall either go mad revelation flee light peace safety new dark age. -H. P. Lovecraft, Call Cthulhu {lovecraftr} contains H. P. Lovecraft’s corpus R datasets textual analysis. repository contains raw txt files RDA files. See reference list available works.

title: H. P. Lovecraft's works, for text analysis
text: Install GitHub using {devtools}: {remotes}:

title: H. P. Lovecraft's works, for text analysis
text: Character vectors individual works can accessed several ways: entire corpus can accessed tibble :
code: cthulhu <- lovecraftr::the_call_of_cthulhu head(cthulhu) #> [1] "THE CALL OF CTHULHU"                                                             #> [2] ""                                                                                #> [3] "Of such great powers or beings there may be conceivably a survival...a survival" #> [4] "of a hugely remote period when...consciousness was manifested, perhaps, in"      #> [5] "shapes and forms long since withdrawn before the tide of advancing"              #> [6] "humanity...forms of which poetry and legend alone have caught a flying memory" data("the_call_of_cthulhu") corpus <- lovecraftr::lovecraft_corpus()  corpus |>   dplyr::filter(title == "THE CALL OF CTHULHU") |>   head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   title               text                                                       #>   <chr>               <chr>                                                      #> 1 THE CALL OF CTHULHU "THE CALL OF CTHULHU"                                      #> 2 THE CALL OF CTHULHU ""                                                         #> 3 THE CALL OF CTHULHU "Of such great powers or beings there may be conceivably … #> 4 THE CALL OF CTHULHU "of a hugely remote period when...consciousness was manif… #> 5 THE CALL OF CTHULHU "shapes and forms long since withdrawn before the tide of… #> 6 THE CALL OF CTHULHU "humanity...forms of which poetry and legend alone have c… data("lovecraft")

title: H. P. Lovecraft's works, for text analysis
text: Please cite package use .
code: citation("lovecraftr") #> To cite package 'lovecraftr' in publications use: #>  #>   Bradford J (2024). _lovecraftr: H. P. Lovecraft's works, for text #>   analysis_. <https://github.com/jrdnbradford/lovecraftr/>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {lovecraftr: H. P. Lovecraft's works, for text analysis}, #>     author = {Jordan Bradford}, #>     year = {2024}, #>     url = {https://github.com/jrdnbradford/lovecraftr/}, #>   }

title: Dataset of Lovecraft's corpus — lovecraft
text: tibble 43,347 rows 2 columns: title Title work text ~80 characters text title

title: Lovecraft's Corpus — lovecraft_corpus

title: Lovecraft's Corpus — lovecraft_corpus
text: data frame Lovecraft's corpus

title: Lovecraft's Corpus — lovecraft_corpus
code: lovecraft_corpus() #> # A tibble: 43,347 × 2 #>    title                       text                                              #>    <chr>                       <chr>                                             #>  1 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS "AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS"                     #>  2 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS ""                                                #>  3 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS "I"                                               #>  4 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS ""                                                #>  5 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS "I am forced into speech because men of science … #>  6 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS "without knowing why. It is altogether against m… #>  7 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS "opposing this contemplated invasion of the anta… #>  8 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS "and its wholesale boring and melting of the anc… #>  9 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS "reluctant because my warning may be in vain."    #> 10 AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS ""                                                #> # ℹ 43,337 more rows
